com.betfair.cougar.transport.impl.protocol.http

Interface ContentTypeNormaliser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContentTypeNormaliserImpl

    public interface ContentTypeNormaliser
    Responsible for getting the media type of requests and responses.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addValidContentTypes(Set<String> validContentType, javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType normalisedContentType)
      Adds a set of valid content types and associated media type to this content type normaliser.
      void addValidEncodings(Set<String> validEncodings)
      Adds a set of valid encodings to this content type normaliser.
      String getNormalisedEncoding(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get the Encoding for the HttpServletRequest and corresponding HttpServletResponse.
      javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType getNormalisedRequestMediaType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get the MediaType of the content of the HttpServletRequest.
      javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType getNormalisedResponseMediaType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get the MediaType for the content of the HttpServletResponse for the request.

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalisedRequestMediaType

        javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType getNormalisedRequestMediaType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the MediaType of the content of the HttpServletRequest. This is determined from the Content-Type header for POST requests. For POST requests with no Content-Type header, or an invalid value, a CougarValidationException is thrown For GET requests this method will return null.
        Throws:
        CougarValidationException

      • getNormalisedResponseMediaType

        javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType getNormalisedResponseMediaType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the MediaType for the content of the HttpServletResponse for the request. MediaType is determined first of all by a MessageConstants.FORMAT_PARAMETER parameter, or if that is not present, by the request Accept-Types header. If no accept types have been set on the request then a default value is returned. If an invalid accept type is set a CougarValidationException is thrown.
        Throws:
        CougarValidationException
        See Also:
        MessageConstants.FORMAT_PARAMETER

      • getNormalisedEncoding

        String getNormalisedEncoding(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the Encoding for the HttpServletRequest and corresponding HttpServletResponse.

      • addValidContentTypes

        void addValidContentTypes(Set<String> validContentType,
                        javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType normalisedContentType)
        Adds a set of valid content types and associated media type to this content type normaliser.

      • addValidEncodings

        void addValidEncodings(Set<String> validEncodings)
        Adds a set of valid encodings to this content type normaliser.
